summary: An Ordinance of the City of Seattle granting to the Oregon and Washington Railroad Company, its successors and assigns, the right, privilege and authority to lay down and construct, maintain and operate, temporary railroad tracks and platforms upon and along the easterly sixteen (16) feet of railroad avenue, between the south line of Dearborn street and the north line of Plummer Street, and upon the westerly twenty-three (23) feet of Block 328 Seattle Tide Lands, and the westerly thirty-nine (39) feet of Charles Street, and to erect upon Blocks 328 and 329 Seattle Tide Lands, respectively, temporary frame passenger and freight stations.
